page.title: 06THE UNEMPLOYED
page.content: In May 1985 the estimated unemployment rate in Clydebank District was 16.4%. The population was approximately 51,000. Clydebank District Council does not work alone in helping the unemployed : it is assisted by Strathclyde Regional Council and the Government. Although money is restricted Clydebank supports one of the largest community pro- grammes in Scotland.The {ENTERPRISE {ZONE}was the first one of its kind. It has had beneficial effects for Clydebank.The District Council makes many concessions for the unemployed, in such areas as tennis and the swimming baths.Most entrances fees are at juvenile rates.There are no council travel concessions. The{UB40 CENTRE}is Clydebanks Unemployed Workers Centre.75% of the funding comes from the Scottish Office
